clinical_study.brief_title: Robot Assisted Gait Training in Patients With Infratentorial Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Robot Assisted Gait Training in Patients With Infratentorial Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: The Effect of Robot Assisted Gait Training in Patients With Infratentorial Stroke

detailed_description.textblock: The hypothesis is to determine the robotic gait training would be better than conventional therapy regarding the postural balance.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Berg Balance Scale at 4 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Berg Balance Scale assess the functional balance ability of participants with observation of 14 tasks, representing functional movements common in daily life

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks from baseline, 8 weeks from baseline, 12 weeks from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Berg Balance Scale assess the functional balance ability of participants with observation of 14 tasks, representing functional movements common in daily life

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks from baseline, 8 weeks from baseline, 12 weeks from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Trunk impairment scale performs to evaluate the sitting balance and trunk control ability examining static sitting balance, dynamic sitting balance, and coordination

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks from baseline, 8 weeks from baseline, 12 weeks from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Categorizes patients according to basic motor skills necessary for functional ambulation. It represents the status of ambulation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks from baseline, 8 weeks from baseline, 12 weeks from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: 10m walk test is used to examine gait speed, in which participant was asked to walk on a 14 meter of walkway wearing harness with two conditions; with the fastest speed or with self-selected comfortable speed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks from baseline, 8 weeks from baseline, 12 weeks from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Fugl-Meyer Assessment uses to examine the motor function and coordination of affected lower extremity

secondary_outcome.measure: Korean version of Falls efficacy scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks from baseline, 8 weeks from baseline, 12 weeks from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Asseses perception of balance and stability during activities of daily living Assesses fear of falling in the elderly population

secondary_outcome.measure: Scale for the assessment and rating of ataxia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks from baseline, 8 weeks from baseline, 12 weeks from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Scale for the assessment and rating for infratentorial stroke

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks from baseline, 8 weeks from baseline, 12 weeks from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Each subject performs the following four tasks resembling Romberg test: standing with their feet positioning with the distance between their shoulders with eyes open (FSEO) or closed (FSEC), and standing with their feet together with eyes open (FTEO) or closed (FTEC). Each task is performed for 20 seconds and repeat for three times.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with infratentorial stroke
- Cognitively intact enough to understand and follow the instructions from the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- chronic neurological pathology
- orthopedic injuries
- femur lengths of less than 34cm
- severely limited range of lower extremity joint motion
- medical instability
